page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Mr & Mrs Metson run Old Wyther's Farm which is a dairy farm with twenty cows and twenty Heifers.Mrs Metson rises at 5.30am.She & her husband feed the animals first of all,which includes cats,dogs,horses and cattle.While Mr Metson milks the the cows by machine, Mrs Metson is busy bottling the milk ready for the milk round.The milk has to be cooled before bottling.The farmer and his wife have there breakfast and then mRs Metson sets off on her milk round at 9am.the round covers High Ongar,Norton heath and Nine Ashes.She is back at the farm about 11am,in time to prepare the lunch,which they have at 12 0'clock. After lunch there is field work to be done.About 4.30pm they break for tea and then Mrs Metson milks the cows while Mr metson washes the bottles for the next day.
